intro: Phyllagathis atroviolacea, commonly known as the black violet ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark violet to blackish flowers and aromatic leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native habitat.
